questions.question_text: What are the two parts of a root event dataset?

discussion.content: Answer is C, P232 of F2

(Page 232) Data Model Events
• Event datasets contain constraints and fields
• Constraints are essentially the search broken down into a
hierarchy
• Fields are properties
associated with the events
See p.236-237 in F2

questions.question_text: When using timechart, how many fields can be listed after a by clause?

choices.B: 1, because _time is already implied as the x-axis.
choices.C: 2, because one field would represent the x-axis and the other would represent the y-axis.
choices.A: 0, because timechart doesn't support using a by clause.
choices.D: There is no limit specific to timechart.

discussion.content: B is the correct ans
B is true

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B
B IS CORRECT! :)

Selected Answer: B
Correct is B
B is correct
B is correct (F2, p.67)

questions.question_text:
A field alias has been created based on an original field. A search without any transforming commands is then executed in Smart Mode.
Which field name appears in the results?

choices.B: Both will appear in the Interesting Fields list, but only if they appear in at least 20 percent of events.
choices.A: Both will appear in the All Fields list, but only if the alias is specified in the search.
choices.D: The alias only appears in the All Fields list and the original field only appears in the Interesting Fields list.
choices.C: The original field only appears in All Fields list and the alias only appears in the Interesting Fields list.

discussion.content: I think B is the Ans
B is true

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

comments.content:
Because you don't necessarily need to specify the alias in the search. If it appears in at least 20% of events, it will appear in the interesting fields even if you didn't specify it in the search. 

A would be correct only in case of "Fast Mode" enabled.

discussion.content: Why A is incorrect ?
B is the correct answer

choices.C: A macro is a reusable search string that may have a flexible time range.
choices.B: A macro is a reusable search string that must have a fixed time range.
choices.D: A macro is a reusable search string that must contain only a portion of the search.
choices.A: A macro is a reusable search string that must contain the full search.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements describes macros?

comments.content: Yes, also I think that C option is correct

discussion.content: C is the correct answer as Macros can be a full search string or portion of search while you can select the time range at search time so Answer is C
C shld be the answer
Damn what a sneaky tricky question. My initial thoughts were either A or D but as others have pointed out it's only part of answer. C seems most likely correct

Selected Answer: C
A and D are half correct, macros can be a full or a portion of a search. But the most correct answer is that they may have flexible time range

Selected Answer: C
I think that C option is correct

Selected Answer: C
Yes, C is the correct Answer

Answer is C
See F2 p.210
the trick is must/may
I think A is the answer

questions.question_text: In what order are the following knowledge objects/configurations applied?

discussion.content: Field Extractions, Field Aliases, Lookups ..B

1. Fields Extractions
2. '' Aliases
3. Calculated ''
4. Lookups
5. Event Types
6. Tags

Selected Answer: B
Ans is B -
Updated Link >https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Knowledge/Searchtimeoperationssequence
Is Actually A
Ans is B - https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.0.6/Knowledge/Searchtimeoperationssequence
